title: Beta Test
logline: A prized courtesan on the eve of her sale risks everything in a dangerous game of Go against a wealthy merchant, gambling her only chance at freedom to pursue a love she's only known from afar.
synopsis:
In the gilded cage of Lu Xian, the most prestigious brothel in the region, Mei has been raised as a living treasure—educated in poetry, trained in seduction, and groomed for a life of elegant servitude. Now of age, she faces her inevitable purchase, with a powerful military general and a wealthy merchant vying for ownership of her future. Yet from her terrace, Mei has spent years watching Lin, a humble florist whose tender devotion to his flowers has taught her what genuine love might look like—patient, nurturing, freely given.

Desperate to seize control of her destiny, Mei approaches the gambling-prone merchant Min Zhu with an audacious wager: a game of Go where victory means her freedom. Outmatched in strategy, she draws upon every lesson of her training, using her arts not to seduce but to survive, clouding his judgment long enough to claim an impossible victory. As the merchant pays for her freedom with his own money, Mei sends a letter to the florist she has loved in secret, confessing her devotion and her hope.

With bare feet and wild hair, Mei runs through the evening streets to Lin's shop, where he sits reading her words by lantern light. When he opens his door to find her standing there—no longer a jewel in a gilded box but a woman choosing her own path—two strangers finally meet, and Mei discovers whether love observed can become love lived.
themes: Freedom and self-determination, the commodification of women, love as tender cultivation versus possession, the courage to risk everything for authenticity
world_rules: Set in historical China during a period of rigid social hierarchy, where courtesans occupy a complex position—celebrated for their artistic refinements yet ultimately property to be bought and sold. The brothel Lu Xian operates under strict codes: Madame Chou controls all transactions, courtesans may accumulate personal savings through performances, and a woman's worth is determined by her training, beauty, and virginity. Go serves as both entertainment and serious gambling among the merchant class, with wagers considered binding contracts of honor. The florist trade represents honest, humble labor—a world entirely separate from the perfumed halls of pleasure houses, yet visible from Mei's terrace, symbolizing the ordinary life forever denied to women of her station.
lighting: Golden hour warmth and soft lantern glow contrasted with cool blue moonlight; intimate candlelit interiors with silk-filtered light creating sensual shadows; natural daylight streaming through wooden lattice screens
vibe: Intimate, yearning, delicate, quietly defiant, romantically melancholic

characters.name: Mei
characters.description: Mei possesses an ethereal, porcelain beauty that stops hearts and empties purses. She stands at modest height with a willowy, graceful build, her posture impeccable from years of training yet somehow still suggesting vulnerability. Her hair is lustrous black silk that falls past her waist when unbound, usually arranged in elaborate styles adorned with jade pins. Her eyes are dark pools of intelligence and carefully concealed longing, almond-shaped and framed by naturally curved lashes. Her skin is pale as moonlight, unblemished and soft, her lips naturally rose-tinted. Her hands are her most expressive feature—small, elegant, trained to pour tea and play instruments with equal artistry.

characters.name: Lin Wei
characters.description: Lin possesses a quiet handsomeness that reveals itself slowly, like a flower opening. He stands at average height with a lean, wiry build earned through physical labor rather than martial training. His shoulders are broad but he holds them modestly, as if apologizing for taking up space. His hair is simple black, worn in a practical topknot that often comes loose, with strands falling across his forehead. His eyes are warm brown, crinkled at the corners from squinting in sunlight, remarkably kind and observant. His skin is healthy bronze from outdoor work, his hands rough with calluses yet impossibly gentle. A small scar marks his left thumb from a pruning accident. He radiates an aura of peaceful contentment.

characters.name: Min Zhu
characters.description: Min Zhu cuts an imposing figure of cultivated prosperity. He is tall and substantial, carrying extra weight that speaks of abundant living rather than sloth, with the confident posture of a man accustomed to being the most important person in any room. His hair is still mostly black, silvering at the temples, worn in an elaborate topknot secured with gold pins. His face is round and shrewd, with calculating eyes that miss nothing of monetary value, a well-groomed beard, and lips that curl easily into satisfied smiles. His skin is pale and soft, protected from labor and sun. His hands are manicured, adorned with jade rings. He projects an aura of absolute material confidence.

characters.name: Madame Chou Lian
characters.description: Madame Chou carries herself with the absolute authority of a woman who has survived and thrived in a brutal world. She is of medium height but seems taller through sheer presence, her figure still graceful though fuller with age. Her hair is silver-streaked black, always immaculately styled in elaborate arrangements that took an hour to achieve. Her face is a masterwork of preserved beauty—high cheekbones, intelligent eyes lined with experience, lips that have forgotten how to smile without calculation. Her skin shows age gracefully, powdered and cared for. Her hands are elegant but strong, capable of tenderness and cruelty in equal measure. She projects an aura of absolute control.

characters.name: General Zhoa Bingwen
characters.description: General Zhoa is an imposing wall of disciplined muscle and controlled violence. He stands tall and broad, his body a weapon maintained through decades of training, carrying himself with the rigid posture of military command. His hair is iron-gray, cropped short and practical beneath his topknot. His face is a map of campaigns—a scar across his left cheek from a sword, another through his eyebrow, features blunt and weathered by sun and wind. His eyes are hard and assessing, always scanning for threats. His skin is dark from years of outdoor command, his hands calloused from weapons. He projects an aura of contained danger, a sword barely sheathed.

characters.name: Xiao Ying
characters.description: Xiao Ying possesses the deliberate invisibility of the servant class. She is small and slight, barely reaching Mei's shoulder, with the hunched posture of someone accustomed to making herself smaller. Her hair is simple black, pulled back in a plain bun, practical and unremarkable. Her face is pleasant but ordinary—round cheeks, small nose, eyes that are kind but trained to look down. Her skin is rougher than the courtesans', marked by work. Her hands are red and chapped from washing. She moves through spaces like a ghost, noticed only when needed, carrying an aura of gentle competence.

locations.name: Mei's Private Terrace
locations.description: An intimate wooden balcony extending from Mei's private quarters on the upper floor of Lu Xian brothel. The terrace features weathered cedar planks, a delicate carved wooden railing with peony motifs, and just enough space for one person to stand or sit on a small cushioned stool. Potted orchids line the corners, and a silk privacy screen can be drawn across the entrance. The vantage point offers a perfect, partially concealed view of the street below and the florist shop directly across.

locations.name: The Street of Fragrant Commerce
locations.description: A well-worn thoroughfare of packed earth, smoothed by generations of foot traffic, cart wheels, and sedan chairs. The road is approximately fifteen feet wide, lined on both sides by established merchant shops with wooden facades and overhanging second-floor balconies. Drainage channels run along the edges, and periodic stone stepping blocks allow pedestrians to cross during rain. The road connects the pleasure district to the main marketplace.

locations.name: Mei's Private Chamber
locations.description: An exquisitely appointed room befitting Lu Xian's most prized courtesan. The space measures roughly twenty by twenty-five feet with twelve-foot ceilings supported by dark lacquered wooden beams. The floor is covered in fine woven bamboo mats of pale gold. A low mahogany table sits center-room, currently set with a wooden go board. Red silken bedding adorns an elevated sleeping platform against one wall. Folding screens painted with mountain landscapes and cranes provide privacy. A bronze mirror, cosmetics table, and wardrobe of fine robes occupy another corner.

locations.name: Lu Xian Pleasure House
locations.description: A legendary three-story establishment renowned throughout the region for its refined courtesans. The building dominates its street corner with imposing red-lacquered wooden architecture, curved tile roofing with decorative dragon finials, and elaborate carved panels depicting scenes of poetry and music. The ground floor features a grand reception hall with silk cushions, low tables, and a performance stage. Upper floors contain private chambers accessible via a central wooden staircase. Red silk lanterns hang from every eave.

locations.name: Lin's Flower Shop
locations.description: A humble but lovingly maintained two-story wooden structure serving as both shop and living quarters. The ground floor opens directly onto the street through removable wooden panels, displaying an abundance of potted flowers, cut arrangements, and gardening implements. Wooden shelves line the walls holding ceramic vases, pruning tools, and seed containers. A worn wooden counter serves customers. The back area contains a small table where Lin takes his meals and reads by lantern light. A narrow staircase leads to modest living quarters above. Every surface shows the gentle wear of dedicated craftsmanship.
